Author: sœÜldat#8733
Content:
Yeah, it can be confusing. Maybe give an concret example with Eth. 
For example, when you create an ERC-20 on Eth, you are 100% dependent on the Eth blockchain.
So if the Eth network crashes, your company crashes too.
And if you want to leave the Eth network you have to develop your own blockchain and swap your ERC-20 tokens, as for EOS for example and can make investors lose confidence and it costs millions.. 
I don't know it's just an idea.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: In regards to the explanation of independent chains we've been employing two analogies.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: 1) Other platforms/eth are like a giant highway dapps as cars. When there were less cars its was fine, but as the influx of cars exceeded the limited lanes in the highway traffic becomes inevitable.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: KMD gives you your own dedicated private highway. If you outgrow that, we can add another lane (scaling solution) on demand. We can continue to do this to scale linearly.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: 2) If you lived in an apt complex, would you pay for internet that was being shared by the entire building? Eth/other platforms is like sharing a single wifi/broadband connection and being affected by other people streaming, gaming, or downloading etc

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: KMD gives you your own dedicated wifi and internet per unit. If bandwidth usage exceeds you can always upgrade (scaling). This has no limit.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we've used the road one a lot with influencers and research groups and press and was well received.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: the wifi one can be extended to our other pillars, so i'm thinking we might use that one

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: as your wouldn't join a wifi network that allowed anyone to pry into your browsing and history...people deserve privacy

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: you wouldn't join a wifi if they controlled and limited what sites/apps you could access - need interoperability

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: you wouldn't go on a wifi /isp that took hours/days to setup, need special hw, complex configuration. - need simplicity, we have end to end solutions and whitelabel products that accelerate deployment

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I'm not sold on the wifi analogy

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: ok fair enough

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: just wanted to avoid having separate analogies for each topic we talk about. i'm open to suggestions.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: cars/highway seems like the better angle imo. most people can relate to driving faster with more lanes

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
We have some time wanted to bring more transparency on our marketing efforts, and as a result of that we have created a public marketing Trello board.

We will keep it up to date and share everything we can. It is a new thing, so there are probably some things missing that I didn't think of. I would us also to document our marketing strategy there later on.

**Public Marketing Board**: https://trello.com/b/xCc8hngf/public-komodo-marketing-board

# How it works

* Post your marketing ideas to our forum or share them on Discord (https://forum.komodoplatform.com/c/marketing)
* Ask questions here on this channel
* Provide us feedback on things that are not yet published, so we can do even better marketing!

It's a win-win for our team and for our active community. You will get an insight into what will be happening and we will get valuable feedback and more ideas.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Thank you for the ideas @jorian , they are good ones.

There definitely is room to improve for us. We should produce content in more regular interwals and maybe our focus on a single campaign has made us blind to some of the things we could have blogged about. Many times, however, we need a bit more time to write about something and often we have hard time understanding the technical aspects and angles.

Example 1: You suggested a blog about *"the creation of several third party ecosystem developers, like DEVSEC, ChainZilla etc."* ‚Äì This is definitely a blog we will write. The situation is very young still, however. These businesses are just setting themselves up. Also our business development team is planning how we handle this exactly. Thus it's better to wait for the situation to mature, at least in my opinion. A blog about this in 1 month will be just as powerful as it would be today.

Example 2:  *"someone doing a write-up about what the consequences of the ASIC for KMD are"* ‚Äì sounds interesting, but I'm not sure what this is about. Our marketing team needs a better bridge to the technical minds who would feed us content. Indeend, @jorian if you could help us in this perhaps we could talk. We are looking people like you.

Example 3: - *"someone doing a write-up about what ZEC is doing and why or why not KMD is integrating their updates"* ‚Äì the same as above, our resources are limited and it takes a long time for us to understand these in enough detail to blog about them. We need a dedicated technical person to help us out.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
*"the importance of GAME using dPoW (or maybe after a couple of months to test the time a bit)"*
 ‚Äì¬†A team decision was made not to draw too much attention to our dPoW promise as of yet, because it's in PEN testing and so on. Thus our marketing team has only been able to retweet mentions and not directly blog about it. We will be making a blog post about this in time once we are ready to market this feature. It will still work as we can interview GAME and explain that they have been using our security service for 3 months without any attacks, and so on.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
*"crypto conditions, scaling and all that has been going on in #dev-scalability"*
 ‚Äì We have been giving the stress test small mentions here and there. However, it has been a conscious decision on our part not to make too much noise about it until the numbers have been validated and the infrastructure is ready. We haven't had any timeline on how long it takes to setup the infrastructure and it is better to make the noice once we know for sure when the actual live marketable stress test will happen.

*"(a short summary of) the advancements in CHIPS and the creation of the CHIPS community"*
‚Äì Good point, we should, but there is no rush. CHIPS project was started with the decision to have ZERO marketing for it.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
'All in all let me just sum up this to two points:

1) Yes, our marketing could do better job on few things. We are improving and now we want to get you guys more involved.

2) One problem we have indentified is that Komodo is all over the place ‚Äì¬†and with that we mean the messages we send out through marketing

We are trying to focus on one talking point at a time and build campaigns. Since the ICO our marketing has been reactionary but we want to get to a position when we can plan and anticipate. That means that we are not going to talk about all the "noice" that is going on before it is mature enough to be properly marketed (i.e. CHIPS and Assetchain businesses).

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
**Then what do we talk about today?**
Right now we started our "Komodo Evolution" campaign in which we revealed our 5 technology pillars. We will talk about security, scalability, interoperability, privacy, and simplicity ‚Äì and how a blockchain platform/ecosystem needs them all.

These are the 5 main selling points why a business should use Komodo instead of some other blockchain/technology provider. From this campaign it is natural to transition more towards

 a) scalability test marketing ‚Äì including some short of an online event with a scalability test demonstration
 b) announcing how to get started with Komodo through the 3rd party businesses

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
## Why don't we market Agama Wallet more?

We would love to market Agama Wallet more, but for that to happen our team needs to finalise PEN testing. Our team must be sure that there are no critical bugs or user-experience issues. Our marketing team needs a green light from the testing team.

Next, we need to work out a new landing page the dApp deserves. We might soon have something exciting to announce as Steve has been talking with one Agency who is going to help us build THE BEST multi-coin wallet on the industry. 

According to Steve, these guys are extremely excited about Komodo tech.
